RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 88. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOUNT UP bumped lightly with a foe leaving the gate then was coaxed to show speed, contested the pace on the inside of rivals, vied along the rail on the turn, was asked approaching the five-sixteenths, turned into upper stretch on even terms for the front then dropped just behind the runner-up while remaining on his inside lead, was pulled in by the rider with a tug of the left-rein and switched to the proper lead at the eighth-pole, fought back very gamely in the final furlong, brushed with the runner-up late and narrowly prevailed under strong handling. COALVILLE stalked the leading duo on the outside, engaged those opponents while four then three wide on the turn, took a short lead into upper stretch then dropped to the two path, lugged in while battling outside of the winner with a narrow advantage, was put to a left-handed crop coming to the furlong marker, had the riders hand come very close to the head of the winner at that juncture, continued to battle outside with a narrow advantage while kept off the inside foe under extra right-rein pressure and a continued left-handed crop, brushed with the winner late and was denied while just able to get the place. TREATY OBLIGATION made light contact with foes on both sides while slowest into stride then was hustled, moved up to race just off the pace with seven-furlongs to run then came under restraint, was eased back coming to the half-mile pole, drafted inside while behind the leaders on the turn, was roused near the five-sixteenths, turned into the stretch in the two path, moved out while chasing the leading duo outside the furlong marker, gained into the final sixteenth and just missed while clear for the show. BIG NIGHT OUT broke in then bumped lightly with a rival, was rated just off the pace, drafted two then three wide while under snug restraint behind foes on the turn, was roused four wide into the stretch, chased outside to the finish and lacked the needed kick. NIGHT CHANT contested the pace, vied between horses in the two path on the turn, dropped back three wide into the stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Mount Up
ENTRY.OWNER: St Elias Stable West Point Thoroughbreds and Masiello Robert
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bump brk,coaxed,ins foe,ins trn,fought back gamely,prevail

ENTRY.NAME: Treaty Obligation
ENTRY.COMMENT: light bmp btwn brk,last away,mvd up7/8,ins trn,mvd out,chsd,gaind

ENTRY.NAME: Big Night Out
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,light bump,rated,2-3p turn,ask 4p1/4,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Night Chant
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace outside foe,btwn 2path turn,drop back 3path1/4,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Coalville
ENTRY.OWNER: Lawrence William H Drown Jeffrey Rachel Don Don Alberto Stable and Bridlewood Fa
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside,bid 4-3p turn,led into upper,2p3/16,lug in,denied

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 1M Turf CR: 108. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 100000. (UP TO $17,400 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Ol der, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Clai m Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track.) (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EASTER (FR) got away slowest of all getting briefly taken in hand and conceding four to five lengths to the front before settling into stride, settled just off the inside at the tail of the field, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled out four wide into upper stretch, closed well outside and was up in the last jumps to the finish. CHASING THE CROWN just off the inside tracking from just off the pace, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took over command spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, came out a furlong out a path, dug in under growing threat from a pair and drifted out near the sixteenth marker, then came out when getting collared by the top one and forced VERBAL to steady to his immediate outside while along for the place honors. VERBAL tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, tipped out nudging DUKE OF HAZZARD out to make a clear lane, rallied loosely between foes to the finish and was forced to steady when impeded by CHASING THE CROWN coming outwards with seventy yards to run and was along for the show honors. DUKE OF HAZZARD (FR) two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch, got nudged out a path by the aforementioned foe nearing the eighth pole, then kept on to the finish. SKY AND SAND coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside shaking away midway down the backstretch, continued along the inside through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, cut the corner into upper stretch displaced from the front, weakened in the late stages. SEVEN CHANNELS tracked the pace along the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and tired. There was a Stewards' inquiry into the stretch run as well as a Claim of foul by the rider of VERBAL alleging interference against CHASING THE CROWN in deep stretch. After review, it was deemed that CHASING THE CROWN had interfered with VERBAL and therefore CHASING THE CROWN was disqualified from second and placed third prior to the race being declared official. Please note that a head on replay of the start was unavailable and therefore the details of why EASTER was off slowest could not be ascertained.

ENTRY.NAME: Verbal
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, coax 5/16, 2w 1/4, nudged foe, steady, impeded late

ENTRY.NAME: Seven Channels
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Duke of Hazzard (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, nudged out, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Chasing the Crown
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp Staudacher David and Carlesimo Angelo
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, coaxed 5/16, up 2w 1/4p, came out 3x str, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Easter (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 2p at rear, angled 4w upper, closed, up last jumps

ENTRY.NAME: Sky and Sand
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing and Magnifico Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, shook away, headed, cut corner, wknd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 36000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GREATEST LOVE prompted the pace on the outside, drew even with the leader in the three path on the turn, was asked near the five-sixteenths, took over in upper stretch, disposed of the runner-up into the final furlong and edged clear under steady urging. VALLARAND went to the front, showed the way while inside of a foe, was asked while two path to the inside on the turn, lost the advantage to the winner under a drive in upper stretch and was outfinished but held the place. GRINGOTTS was rated off the pace, came under urging while two then three wide on the turn, moved out under a drive in upper stretch and lacked the needed kick while well clear for the show. RAFFINITY settled off the pace, was roused three then four wide on the turn, remained on her inside lead in the stretch and failed to respond. TRADE SECRET showed speed on the inside then dropped off the pace near the three-quarter pole, dropped back while saving ground on the turn and capitulated. CARLY HUSTLE settled at the rear, angled out outside the three-quarter pole, was urged four wide on the turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Trade Secret
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed inside duo,drop back 3/4,chased inside turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Carly Hustle
ENTRY.OWNER: Calia Richard Ginesin Gus A and Toscano Jr John T
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled at rear,angled out 3/4,4wide turn,no factor,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Gringotts
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated,asked 2-3path turn,mvd out 3/16,chased,missed 2nd,clr3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Vallarand
ENTRY.OWNER: Grab Gary and Chief Big Blue Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed way,2p-ins turn,headed 3/16,outfinished,held2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Raffinity
ENTRY.OWNER: Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R and Gurdon Andrew
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, roused 3-4wide turn, inside lead stretch, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Greatest Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted outside,3path turn,ask5/16,lead3/16,edged clear,driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 6F Inner turf CR: 81. Starter Allowance Purse 65000. INNER TURF (UP TO $11,310 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ACT OF CONGRESS established the front and showed the way through swift splits just off the inside, remained just off the rail through the turn remaining patiently handled and took the inside route into upper stretch, got roused straightened away, edged clear under a drive to the eighth pole, held safe to the finish to prevail. WESTERN LANE chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch, closed well and was up for the place honors in the final jump in a blanket finish behind the top one. BOSS OF ALL two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun three wide into upper stretch, ran on to secure the show honors. BRISKY FROLIC chased three to four wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch, kept on to the finish but was out-finished in the late stages. BUSTIN BULLET four then three wide in pursuit in aim of the leader, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, weakened in the late going. TRY IT AGAIN chased three then two wide coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, spun three wide into upper stretch and stayed on one paced to the finish. LOLA FLO chased along the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, took the inside route into upper stretch, weakened in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Lola Flo
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, coaxed 2p near 1/4, inside 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Western Lane
ENTRY.OWNER: Blue Streak Racing LLC Second Opinion Stable and Spiesman Rich
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, coaxed 3/8, angled 4w upper, closed well, up for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Boss of All
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Try It Again
ENTRY.OWNER: Arenas Marcelo Giangrande Salvatore and Giangrande Stefano
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Brisky Frolic
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-4w, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, kept on, out-finished

ENTRY.NAME: Bustin Bullet
ENTRY.OWNER: Marjac Pino Stable JTW Stable LLC and Ruggeri Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Act of Congress
ENTRY.OWNER: Flying P Stable and Levine Bruce N
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, inside 1/4, roused, edged clear, held safe

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 5F Turf CR: 85. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be ru n at Five Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PLEASE ADVISE chased the pace on the outside then in the three path on the turn, rallied to the lead in upper stretch, shook two foes into the final furlong and held under steady urging. NOTED broke in and brushed the gate then bumped with a foe before being taken up some, raced under urging towards the rear, traveled around the turn in the three then four path, was driven five wide into the stretch and finished with good energy to garner the place. DARK VINTAGE (IRE) was hustled from the gate, disputed the pace on the inside of a foe, vied along the rail on the turn, was asked for his best in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened but held the show. CULPRIT contested the pace on the outside, vied in the three then two path on the turn, was put to a drive in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and also weakened then missed the show. NOBLE WAVE bumped solidly with a rival at the start, was urged along off the pace, saved ground on the turn and failed to rally. MAYOR JACK bumped solidly with an opponent at the start, showed speed on the inside of foes, steadied while taken back off the pace near the nine-sixteenths, went around the turn in the two path, moved out under a drive in upper stretch and came up empty. DANGEROUS DRIVER hit the outside of the gate and was off slow, spotted the front a few lengths, angled in at the rear, went around the turn in the two path and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Mayor Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd solidly brk,speed,steadied 4-1/2,2path turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Noble Wave
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,urged along,inside turn,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Noted
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,brshd gate,bmpd,tkn up,urged,3-4p,5p1/4,rallied,up2nd

ENTRY.OWNER: Three Chimneys Farm and Stonestreet Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,pace ins foe,rail turn,drop back 1/8,weakened,held3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Culprit
ENTRY.COMMENT: outside pace,vied 3-2path turn,dropped back 1/8,weakened,miss3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Please Advise
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,3path turn,lead 3/16,inched clear1/8,held driving

ENTRY.NAME: Dangerous Driver
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow,angled in,2path turn,no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 103. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 105000. (UP TO $18,270 NYSBFOA) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $80,000. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winn ers Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter Since December 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $80,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GUN IT chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command a furlong out, edged away under a drive to prevail. NOVA RAGS four then three wide in pursuit, got coaxed along at the five-sixteenths, spun three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and kept on to secure the place honors. SECRET RULES chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and kept on to the finish. MR PHIL chased three then two wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch, weakened. CEES GET DEGREES broke out at the start, showed the way three then two wide while in hand, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, cornered just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under threat from a trio and yielded command near the eighth pole, then weakened to the wire.

ENTRY.NAME: Cees Get Degrees
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, in hand 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, yielded 1/8, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Gun It
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, up 1/8, edged away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 100. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 85000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $45,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $45,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due AtTi me Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DAUFUSKIE ISLAND moved in while going to the front, showed the way under some pressure to his outside, vied in the two path on the turn, kicked clear into upper stretch, extended the advantage under a strong hand-ride into the final sixteenth then was put to a lighter hand-ride late while much the best. BIG ENGINE chased the pace, dropped back while inside on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and just got up for the place. UNIQUE UNIONS was well placed just off the pace, came under urging late on the backstretch, chased three then four wide on the turn, pursued the winner under a drive into upper stretch, remained on his his lead until the furlong marker then swapped to the proper lead and missed the place while able to get the show. FOOLISH GHOST moved up to press the pace on the outside, vied in the three path on the turn, dropped back into upper stretch and weakened. SCILLY CAY angled in at the rear near the nine-sixteenths, was urged in the two path going around the turn, spun four wide into upper stretch, moved further out in the final furlong and failed to threaten. THRILL OF IT settled towards the rear, angled out near the nine-sixteenths pole, went four to five wide on the turn, dropped inward in upper stretch and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Engine
ENTRY.OWNER: Rice Linda and Bruce Golden Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace,inside turn,no match,up for place

ENTRY.NAME: Thrill of It
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,angled out 9/16,4-5wide turn,4w1/4,mvd in3/16,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Unique Unions
ENTRY.OWNER: Clear Stars Stable and Mitre Box Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace, chased 3-4path turn, missed 2nd, earned show

ENTRY.NAME: Foolish Ghost
ENTRY.COMMENT: mvd up,pressed outside,vied 3path turn,drop back 3/16,wknd

ENTRY.OWNER: Scuderi Vincent S Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R and Cotrone Robert
ENTRY.COMMENT: moved in,set pace,2path turn,drew off,strong hand-ride

ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in 4-1/2,2path turn,4path3/16,mvd out 1/16,no threat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 85. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 95000. INNER TURF (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At Any Distance Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Cl aim Will Be Void). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRYINMYHEARTOUT got bumped at the start when under coaxing by STEPHANIE'S CHARM, who broke outwards, established the front and showed the way in hand just off the inside, tucked inside half a mile from home and remained patiently handled until set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive inching away to the eighth pole, came under late threat to the inside and held on to score. LIFELOVENLAUGHTER just off the inside tracking the front from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive issuing a challenge through the final furlong but was ultimately repelled at the end. ROOT CAUSE chased three then two wide patiently handled until set down angled out six wide into upper stretch then offered up a mild kick to secure the place honors. BIG BRASS BED four paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked inside half a mile from home, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly to secure the last major share. QUARREL four then three wide in aim of the front, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. FAST KIMMIE three then two wide in closest aim of the leader, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late going. STEPHANIE'S CHARM broke out at the start bumping TRYINMYHEARTOUT, chased along the inside patiently handled until set down taking the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and weakened in the late stages. TAP IT UP broke in brushing the near side stall at the start, chased four then three wide under a ride from the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Stephanie's Charm
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased ins, set down ins 1/4, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Tryinmyheartout
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, coaxed st, in hand 2p, to ins 1/2, 2w 1/4p, held on

ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w in aim, coaxed near 1/4, 3w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w pursuit, set down angled 6w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, dug in, repelled

ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w in aim, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, chased 4-3w, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Big Brass Bed
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w backstretch, to ins 1/2, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, belatedly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 9 1 1/16M Turf CR: 88. Claiming Purse 45000. (UP TO $7,830 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR THREE YEAR OLDS. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $35,000 (1.5% Afte rcare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile and One Sixteenth on the Main Track.) (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SONIC SPEED stalked the pace on the outside then in the two path on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole then took the lead into upper stretch, responded well under threat in the final furlong and just held under strong urging. HILLIARD steadied near another foe who was checking leaving the chute, was reserved off the pace, traveled around the turn in the two path, was roused five wide into the stretch, rallied outside in the final furlong and finished with good energy to just miss while up for the place. ARRIO moved in while going to the front, was well rated while setting the pace on an uncontested lead, vied inside on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the advantage to the winner into upper stretch, fought on well to the finish but missed while clear for the show. SPLENDID SUMMER was rated off the pace, moved from the two path to the four path on the turn, came under a drive in upper stretch, chased the vanguard to the finish and lacked the needed kick. STEELERSFANFORLIFE was rated off the pace, went two then three wide on the turn, was roused into the stretch and lacked the needed response. LIFE AND LIGHT was well placed just off the pace, saved ground on the turn, was roused near the quarter-pole then came off the rail in upper stretch and also lacked the needed response. K P ALL SYSTEMS GO checked near other foes in trouble leaving the chute, was reserved near the back while on the outside but with cover, went four then three wide while roused on the turn, spun six wide into the stretch and failed to rally. CUMBERLAND BLUES settled on the outside without the benefit of cover, was roused in the three path on the turn and failed to respond. PRAYER BOOK was taken under a tight hold early then put under slightly stronger restraint leaving the chute, raced towards the back under reserve, dropped back in the four path on the turn and faltered. VOLIERO checked severely near the rail early then lost position badly leaving the chute, settled near the back, saved ground on the turn and was no factor.

ENTRY.OWNER: Red Storm Stable Photos Finish LLC and Englehart Jeffrey S
ENTRY.COMMENT: checked 1m,reserved,4-3path turn,6w1/4,no rally
